overview:
Peter Borish is the founder Chairman and CEO of Computer Trading Corporation (CTC), an macroeconomic investment fund and an investor/advisor to the Board of Directors of Quadriserv. He serves as the Chairman of the Institute for Financial Markets (IFM) and is a founding investor and member of the Board of Directors of Charitybuzz.

Mr. Borish’s previous positions include Founding partner at Tudor Investment Corporation, Chairman of OneChicago, LLC, CEO of Twinfields Capital Management, Member of the Presidential Task Force on Market Mechanisms (a.k.a. “Brady Commission”) and a position at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

An active philanthropist, Mr. Borish is a Founding Board Member of the Robin Hood Foundation and of Math for America. He is a former Board Member of the Futures Industry Association and a mayoral appointee to the New York City Department of Youth & Community Development.

He earned an M.A. Public Policy from the Gerald R. Ford School of Public Policy at the University of Michigan and a B.A. in economics from the University of Michigan
